title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [28 september 1871]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [28 September 1871]
text: 30 Sept 1869thursdayThursday afternoon my deari have to write again you know i said in my letter if your letter came this week all right maybeemaybe i wouldentwouldn't write well walterWalter the letter and order came all safe but i have been to the post office and the order had not come so of course i couldentcouldn't get the moneyi was going yesterday but just as i was going i had quite an increase in my family maryMary and Louisa and minnyMinny all come bag and baggage they shut up their houses and come to brooklynBrooklyn yesterday i had 5 ladies to tea) walterWalter if you get this fridayFriday i wish you would send me 2 dollars georgeGeorge sent me 2 dollars i rather look for him saturdaySaturday if he dontdon't come i have hardly got any moneythe young man to the office said he would write to you Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [28 September 1871]
